SEARCH
Package com.github.timmy80.mia.core

Class Task

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Task
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExecutionStage, Runnable, Executor
Direct Known Subclasses:
ProbesTask
public abstract class Task extends Thread implements Executor, ExecutionStage
A MiA task. This is intended to be the single point of synchronization.
Author:
anthony

  • Nested Class Summary

    abstract void
    eventStartTask()
    Event method called when this task starts to run on its Thread.
    You can safely override this method to handle the event.
    protected void
    eventStopRequested()
    Event method called when the stop sequence of this task is triggered.
    You can safely override this method to handle the event.
    In order to prevent an immediate stop, you may add one or more epilogs to this Task by calling registerEpilog(CompletableFuture)

      public Task(String name, ApplicationContext appCtx) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructor to associate this task to an ApplicationContext

      appCtx - The application context of this Task
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are set incorrectly, preventing execution

    • Task

      Default constructor.
      The ApplicationContext will be set to ApplicationContext.getDefault().
      Parameters:
      name - Unique name of this Task.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If parameters are set incorrectly, preventing execution

    • registerEpilog

      public void registerEpilog(CompletableFuture<?> epilog)
      Add an epilog to this Task. An epilog will prevent this task from stopping until it's completed.
      An epilog can be any instance of CompletableFuture.
      Parameters:
      epilog - an instance of CompletableFuture

    • stopTask

      public void stopTask()
      Require this task to stop.

    • eventStartTask

      public abstract void eventStartTask()
      Event method called when this task starts to run on its Thread.
      You can safely override this method to handle the event.

    • eventStopRequested

      protected void eventStopRequested()
      Event method called when the stop sequence of this task is triggered.
      You can safely override this method to handle the event.
      In order to prevent an immediate stop, you may add one or more epilogs to this Task by calling registerEpilog(CompletableFuture)

    • getAppCtx

      public ApplicationContext getAppCtx()
      Get the ApplicationContext of this Task;
      Returns:
      the ApplicationContext.

    • newTimeout

      public io.netty.util.Timeout newTimeout(long delayms, TimerTask task)
      Create a new Timeout. If the delay is reached, the timerTask is called on this ExecutionStage.
      Parameters:
      delayms - the delay of this timer in milliseconds
      task - the function called after the delay is reached
      Returns:
      a Timeout for the given args

    • newTimeout

      public io.netty.util.Timeout newTimeout(long delay, TimeUnit unit, TimerTask task)
      Create a new Timeout. If the delay is reached, the timerTask is called on this ExecutionStage.
      Parameters:
      delay - the delay of this timer
      unit - the unit of the delay
      task - the function called after the delay is reached
      Returns:
      a Timeout for the given args
